description:
Pinhole is a Bernal treasure and one of my favorite spots in all of San Francisco. All of the staff is wonderful, but special shout outs to the incredible JoEllen and to the amazing Victoria who happens to be my dog Barnacles' personal favorite staffer.

The coffee is great, the latte art is killer, and the decor is fun and cozy at the same time. Not to mention that they are always running cool little events like full revenue donations to charitable causes and music for tots which my daughter adores.

I'm glad there's such a magical little happy place in my hood.
author: Brandon B.

description:
I've been here four times and have tried four different coffee drinks. They've all been bad. I keep giving them another chance hoping it was a fluke or a new barista. 

When I say "bad" I mean truly awful. Both bitter and burnt tasting at the same time. Seriously, Starbucks is pulling better espresso than this place.

Never again.
author: Captain B.

description:
Quality neighborhood coffee shop.

I visited on a Saturday morning, and there was a small queue out the door. The seating inside is somewhat limited, but we were able to find a space for two at the communal table. The decor is vibrant and fun, making the place quite photogenic - Instagram worthy shots made easy.

For serious coffee aficionados, Pinhole actually carries and assortment of beans from various roasters. I believe they use Linea for their espresso, Verve for their drip and pour over, with a rotating third option featuring yet another roaster. Very cool.

We ordered an oat milk decaf cappuccino, regular cappuccino, and matcha custard cake (they have a selection of tasty treats from Third Culture Bakery to enjoy with your coffee). Heads up! For those who are looking for milk alternatives, they don't serve soy milk here. They carry almond milk or oat milk, however.

On a personal note, I really appreciate the company's attentiveness to customer experiences. I provided some feedback through the Square email receipt, and promptly received personalized follow up messages from the owner, addressing my concerns. Despite my criticisms, the owner replied with professionalism and hospitality - I wasn't expecting it, but I appreciated the conversation. The productive and positive exchange definitely left the door open for an improved experience on our next chance to visit. Overall, a great place to grab a quality cup.
author: Roderick T.

description: Great place, awesome furniture (check those heart shaped chairs made of wood, adorable), fantastic coffee, super friendly service, gaytitude...this is indeed a happy place in the heart of a SF neighborhood I did not know until last week when I girlfriend took me to visit Bernal Heights area. We liked that hood so much, the atmosphere, the coffee, the aromas of coffee come associated in our minds now with Pinhole and the positive vibe. We did not want to leave! Also, it is very airy as you can sit by the windows, one with nice glass rejects decor and another fully open to the street where you can also sit, as there were several customers enjoying the sun outside. Good vibes and design here, plus that coffee.
author: Carmen V.

description:
This is another great coffee spot here in the city. They serve Verve espresso and their pastries are the bomb (my fav is the mushroom croissant- yum!)
The space is tiny, but they have creative (and beautiful) seating. Probably not the ideal spot for a "meeting" but definitely a good spot to chill and sip some good coffee.
author: JonJon W.

description:
Cool, designy cafe w/ vibrant, IG-worthy, modern, and engaging interiors , plus super chill & fun staff who are always ready for a good convo. 

- Cafe located in the hilly Bernal Heights. I can usually find parking nearby. 

- Ordered their Matcha cake (green tea flavored sprinkled w/ powder sugar. The texture is bomb: soft inside & crsipy on the edge) baked by Third Culture bakery & Matcha Latte served on fine ceramics--both are delicious & aesthetically pleasing! Verve coffee roaster available.

- Plenty of unique design books, magazines, photography collections on the shelf. A place to relax, read, and hang out. Also has decors like vintage cameras, polaroids, Pinhole coffee mugs. Very thoughtful display that brings a sense of inspiration & adventure to the day.

- Wish they had Wi-Fi! However the owner specifically wants this space to invite meaningful convos & connections, instead of a place to use laptops.

- The lady Leah who did the colorful wall did an installation at SFO & the factory! A must-see photo spot!
author: Jess W.

description: The amazing staff and great coffee/specialty drinks really make up for any potential uncomfy butts on the wood furniture. This place has really grown on me, becoming my go to coffee shop in the area.
author: Adriana G.

description:
What a cute place!

The coffee shop is hip and earthy with wooden decor and colorful tile walls.  I love the painting of a man in a coffee mug car riding down bernal heights with a pinhole camera attached to his face!  The staff seem pretty friendly and hardworking.

My latte was smooth and well-presented in a nice, big ceramic mug (which is made by a local ceramicist!).  They serve Verve Coffee Roasters, and it seems to rotate from time to time.

The piccolo comes in a small glass and tasted dark and roasted.  The piccolo is like a combination of a latte and a cortado because of the small size and steamed milk.

And you know what makes this place even better??  They serve pastries from Third Culture Bakery!!  The Matcha Green Tea Custard Cake was sooo incredibly good!!  Very soft and delicious, perfectly paired with a drink!

Unfortunately, wifi isn't provided here and I didn't really see outlets either.  Luckily I was using my sister's laptop that is connected to xfinity WiFi so I was able to get some work done still.  Wooden benches can tire your booty out after a while though, but there are a few pillows laying around.  This place seems to promote having conversations and catching up with people or on a good book rather than working on laptops.  The plus side is that having no wifi should (hopefully) keep me from getting too distracted from my textbook readings.

Quality coffee and good vibes here.  Definitely will be coming back often!
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
Love the decor and yes of course coffee is good!

What perks +'s:
+ Coffee. They serve good lattes but wish it was consistent.
+ Decor. Love the woodwork furnishings! It almost feels like drinking in the woods.
+ T-shirts. Usually I do not consider buying one but these designs are worth a look and I may have to get one.
+ Pastries. Matcha custard to cookies to flaky pastries. They must have something to satisfy the sweet tooth.
+ Service. Hey they serve with a smile :)
+ Outdoor bench. I actually sit and hang here to people watch. It's a good spot but not too busy.

What drips -'s:
- Lattes are sometimes heavy on foam and light on milk. Sometimes not filled to top. Sometimes it is to the top. Consistency is an issue.

Overall I walk the extra few block to come here because I like the setting and coffee.
author: Yiven C.

description: Hipster local cafe. #instagramable. Cool spot to have a conversation. Really chill nd relaxed atmosphere.
author: Kenneth T.

description: My boyfriend and I made our way to Pinhole this past Saturday afternoon. We had heard good reviews and were excited to give it a try. When we arrived, there was a short line out the door, which went by quickly. Once at the counter, we were greeted and my boyfriend placed an order for the two of us. He asked for a soy decaf cappuccino to which the baristas looked at each other, smirked, and one responded saying that they actually don't have soy, but carry almond milk and oat milk. My boyfriend proceeded with the rest of the order, but was a bit perturbed by the reaction.  We drank our cappuccinos at the cafe along with a green tea pastry. The matcha custard cup was fine, but I was turned off when I noticed what looked like small metal shavings on the top? Might have been an off-day but I'd give em another try.
author: Camille B.

description: This is what a coffee shop should be. The Staff are professional and courteous. The coffee is good. The decor is super cool, back ground music not to loud so you have the opportunity to have a conversation with your date or enjoying the company of others. Pastries looked good so I will have to return soon to try them out.
author: Manny G.

description:
Spacious coffee shop in Bernal Heights, my wife came for the Matcha latte, I went for the ambiance and lettered magnets on the black magnetic counter. The cafe primarily has coffee or coffee type drinks they do have few pastries to choose from. Few folks set up shops in the corners either working on thesis statements or other school projects. The banter between folks that I overheard was that of planned travel, or how many credits remaining to graduate college.

Group of customers range from really young to really old few families more college and retiree type crowd. The staff is friendly and helpful. One restroom to the side adjacent to the barista counter, quiet enough to read a book and enjoy a cup of joe.

I would venture back and try their afogado

Drinks ****
Price $
Service ****
Ambiance *****
author: Clarence A.

description:
Probably one of the more visually engaging coffee shops that I've seen in a long time, the space seems divided/sectioned, giving each a different style (natural wood furnishes to streamline, simple furnishes). 

Last I had checked they were sourcing from Verve Coffee Roasters/ Linea, but this place is known for sourcing from many known coffee roasters from the country/state. I do say that they have a great variety (in terms of tea and coffee offerings). They source differently for pour overs...bi-monthly, usually--it really adds to a sense of depth and immersion, in that they promote other coffee businesses.

As an added note, these fine people are one of the few (maybe the ONLY) to offer a Piccolo as an espresso drink option in the area. Pinhole does a fine job in serving quality drinks, no matter what bean is in use.
author: Rowby O.

description:
Ordered a warm house latte, but I've seen the shaken iced latte (wished I ordered that instead). Nonetheless, the coffee is good. My very reason of visit was the need to stimulate my caffeine senses. Thus, pinhole was around the corner! Frankly, it is another boujee hipster coffee shop. The rustic, 70's hippie, and sly ambiance lured me in - especially the cute little wallpaper in the corner that says "pinhole" while a man is holding up a camera! I can safely say it is a place to socialize but wouldn't come here to study. Jazz music in the background while I enjoy my latte! San Francisco hipster coffee shop, you did it again! Definitely part of my "will come back soon" list!

Check it out!
author: Christina B.

description:
Umm..pinhole coffee, where have you been all my life?

What an amazing find!  I wish it was closer to my hood (i'm in the outer sunset). Great service, great drinks, what a cool place to have a decent conversation over some joe. 

Besides their coffee, Pinhole also makes a mean matcha tea/latte as well. I got the shaken Matcha latte and was really amazed by how light and refreshing the drink was. Thanks for the suggestion awesome barista. 

The Barista did tell us that there isn't any wifi as they want to promote conversation. So you can come by and do some light reading and chat with friend, but if you're going to be on your laptop for a while, probably not the place. 

Nonetheless, great spot for coffee and latte.
author: Diane T.

description: Lovely staff, cozy space, the perfect spot for a meet-up or some time with a good book. :)
author: Keelia A.

description: Good atmosphere - quiet. The coffee tastes pretty good and the prices are reasonable.
author: Dan B.

description: One of the best coffee in SF in my opinion! My SO always get the affogato and i usually get a regular latte. Its always good and the staff are friendly
author: Rafael A.

description:
Solid coffee and great service. I usually grab a cup when I have some extra time in the morning on my way to work when I'm in SF. :) 

The location is great, and I love their interior! I normally grab a latte, but their americano is delicious.
author: Sophie P.

description: I love this place. Jo-Ellen and friends manage to combine REALLY GOOD coffee with a friendly neighborhood place. We love sitting on the little benches outside with our dog before we stroll down Cortland. I might go there right now in fact!
author: Daniel W.

description: I can't understand why this place is so packed every morning. I've tried to go there twice and both times I had a poor experience. The first time I wanted something for lunch and their answer was "There's a sandwich shop next door " . Second time I wanted a large iced caramel latte and was given a small regular latte with a heart on top that tasted like burnt black coffee , when I complained about my incorrect order the cashier said they only sell one size of coffee and one type latte only. ..How about you tell me that before I paid for it?!!! Also, I ordered a croissant and asked for it to be warmed up. It was given to me cold and same thing. I asked why and the cashier said they don't have anything to warm up their pastries with. Come on!!! Also, I paid like $15 for that. Of course it ended up in the trash can. To me, this place is a fraud. There are at least 2 other coffee shops in the area waaaaay better than this place.
author: Paula G.

description:
Im writing this as I sip my large chai latte, sitting in the cafe relaxed.

It's my first time in, but definitely not my last. The customer service is fantastic, both baristas were very friendly and welcoming. The latte is smooth and delicious. 

The atmosphere is so relaxing and cozy - I love the seating, wood features and plants! 

If they were hiring I would for sure want to apply, but until then, I will settle with drinking their delicious tea and/or coffee, and noming on their delicious pastries (their matcha custard cake is BOMB).
author: Shira S.

description:
My fiancé and I each got oat milk lattes, they were fantastic. He never had a latte with oat milk and I've only been only other coffee place with that milk alternative and we both really enjoyed our drinks.

I also got a matcha scone and devoured it despite having eaten about fifteen minutes prior. It was so good that a too full belly was worth it. 

Parking was easy, we literally drove up and parked right in front of the shop.  

Price wasn't bad, $16 for two lattes and a scone.
author: CaShawnna E.

description: My favorite neighborhood coffee shop in all of SF. Joellen and her team are the friendliest crew, and they make a mean espresso drink.
author: Ruha D.

description:
Their yelp hours are different from their actual hours T__T
I can here at 4pm today and it was closed?!?!
author: Kenneth L.

description: Sundays for me are meant for leisure and time with my little tribe! I love wandering and getting lost in little neighborhoods around the city. This spot is so chill and family friendly. Love their matcha latte. My little humans enjoyed a cup of hot chocolate and played with their magnet wall and letters. Friendly staff, ambiance and customers. No rushing here.
author: Carmelina A.

description:
I must have die and gone to coffee heaven here.  Yes, indeed.  It surely felt that way for us here.  

Let me just begin my review with, of course, by agreeing with my fellow yelpers that have given this place a 5 stars.  The coffee was really amazingly good here.  It's like they perfected the perfect cup of coffee well for me it's the Americano.  I really liked everything about this place and I meant everything.  Loved how the nutty sweet toasty aroma hits my senses as the warm liquid crack warmed my soul.  Omfg if I lived in SF, I would come here almost everyday just for that much needed daily FIX of greatness. 

As for the decor, it's too cute here.  Mad props to the person or people that came up with this artsy hippyish decor cause I know that's not something I can put together at all. 

Besides coffee we also enjoyed some sweets with it.  I had a chocolate cookie that was semi soft with the perfect balance of sea salt.  My partner had the Nutella pop tart.
author: Sathy T.

description: Excellent latte, great ambiance, and delicious matcha pastries! I was however pretty disappointed by their Ethiopian guji pour over. Lacking of any bright notes or flavors and had a bitter aftertaste. Service was also not very friendly.
author: Nadja K.

description: Very relaxed scene. Came to do a photography challenge using their latte art. Barista was very willing to help and extremely nice. She has her own instagram. The coffee was very refreshing.
author: Kelvin M.

description:
Fabulous little space for a coffee shop. The barista behind the counter is super efficient and friendly. Sunny. Open. Cozy. And the coffee is great! I ordered a decaf Gibraltar and it's excellent.

the chairs are more like benches with pillows - good for sitting there for maximum of 2 hours but not too much longer.

I like the location of this cafe which doesn't attract loads of tourists. The people who frequent it are clearly locals and super friendly to the barista, who is a fantastic story teller on the origin and faces behind the coffee beans.
author: Rebecca C.

description: I love this place! It's in my old neighborhood and anytime I'm in the area, I drop in for a latte. Get it with oat milk- so good! It's quaint, the buildout is really cool, and the people are really nice and it's on cute Cortland. I just bought a bag of their coffee and had a cup this morning and it was really good:)
author: Roxi P.

description: Cute space inside and out. Especially cute as a date spot. Wooden interior and chunky ceramic mugs make everything feel extra cozy. I thought it was a bit overpriced for what I was getting.
author: Yad L.

description:
Came with a friend, she loves coffee. I took a macchiato and it was strong and super small. 
Can't say I don't like it, it's just not for me, I'm sure that coffee people would definitely enjoy this taste.
author: Serhii H.

description:
This hipster cafe is located in a quaint neighborhood in Bernal Heights. Parking was easy on a weekday and this place is also really close to a few cute shops such as succulence! The cafe is quite small but has extremely cute decor. The wood theme is enhanced by having chairs and tables that are tree stumps. I really liked the decor a lot and the ambience was very modern. The staff here were very friendly as well.

The coffee here is quite good! My friend got the mocha and I got the latte. Both were very smooth. The latte was creamy and the mocha was not too sweet. They also offer some donuts and pastries. I saw some people doing some work here and I feel like it good be a good place to clear your mind.
author: Catherine S.

description: Super friendly staff. Everything and cream cheese croissant is tooooo good, and of course great coffee.
author: JoAna S.

description: I am not a coffee person, I came here with my boyfriend who is a big coffee lover. Good quality coffee and friendly service makes people come back here. Great location and relaxing atmosphere.
author: Mel C.

description:
This is my favorite spot in San Francisco to relax in a coffee shop, enjoy a quality latte, and read my book peacefully. 

The space is intimate and there is always a spot at the communal-style tables. Lots of light so the ambience is top notch. Also, baristas are helpful and accommodating. 

Also it's really nice that this spot clearly has neighborhood regulars who are friendly with the staff. I always bring my visiting friends to check out this place. Love pinhole :)
author: Anna M.

description:
This is a great coffee shop!  They have great coffee (their pour overs and Americanos are very good), friendly service, and an inviting, artsy-rustic atmosphere.

We just moved to Bernal from the Mission, and are glad to have found our go-to local spot for coffee! :)
author: Barnali D.

description: Not my style of coffee, the taste is nutty bitterness. I think it is better for those who prefer a much denser coffee taste. Ordered a piccolo and a machiaato To-go and they lazed out on the art which was kind of sad. Portions are smaller than other coffee shops and same pricing....Sadly this isn't the place for me
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Great decor, great coffee... They have 3 main options for you:espresso, drip and pour-over. We had Columbian pour over which was nutty and refreshing and their morning Jose which was also great. Gotta love their art!
author: Jan Orhun A.

description: I have been Pinhole Coffee on several occasions, usually a quick stop and I always greeted by warm friendly faces ready to get my coffee on the fly. Coffee here smell so good, and even tastes better. I always have the Peruvian Blend and I never get tired of it. It speaks to me! It's delicious and one of a kind and with the great prices, you can't go wrong being here. If you're a coffee or tea fanatic like myself, there's much variety here to send your imagination running. This shop has a great aesthetic; raw wood, textiles and concrete. It's a good place to relax and unwind and enjoy some good coffee along with & community relations.
author: Mariana C.

description:
Good Matcha either latte or shaken, perfect pair for lemon pistachios donut.
I like the ambience too, pretty laid back & cool.
Sometimes they donate 100% of their revenue to certain organizations (Planned parenthood, Sierra Club & NRDC).
author: Xinta B.

description: I ordered a double shot of espresso with a little bit of hot water and received just the espresso. I asked the barista to add the hot water and she gave me another bigger cup full of water. I explained to her my order and she told me next time to order an Americano because I "just wasted a cup". Really disappointing customer service.
author: Dan B.

description:
The Beautiful Coffeeshop
(With apologies to John Updike)

Though most of them aren't much to post about--
mere cookie-cutter stall or third-wave office space,
their din and pose recalling Tuesday's deal,
their fair-trade coffee soon absorbed--this one,
enjambed between plateau and downward slope
(that liminal instant before the bike begins to coast)
with some small affectation, kids, and dogs,
and special handmade stools of log,
is yet a masterpiece: with flawless brew,
just filtered, in a cup, as if some poet,
extracting this most furtive, vital essence
had set herself to write a liquid verse.
O bitter perfection, not seafoam nor
stardust, how can I keep you? With this review.
author: Dyche M.

description: I'm gonna update just to keep saying that this is the best coffee shop in SF. The owner, Jo, is one of the nicest persons I've ever met, and everyone on the staff is amazing! Pinhole is my second home. Can't wait for a second location in the Bay Area.
author: Paloma M.

description: Best macchiato on my side of town hands down. I like the fact that they open early and I can always find a spot to park. Really nice scone to tip top it off. Friendly skilled baristas! Give them a try!!
author: Lisa S.

description:
A cute coffee shop in a cute neighborhood! Pinhole probably isn't a place where you'd be able to sit with your laptop for several hours at a time, but it's definitely a fun place to stop in and grab a quick cup of joe or catch up with a friend for a little bit. The decor is equally as lovely as the coffee and the baristas! 

I came in closer to closing on a Thursday evening, and the two baristas who were working still cheerfully greeted us and answered any questions we had. The place was empty except for us, which is to be expected at that time, but I'd imagine the place would get really crowded during the mornings and weekends since it is so small. There's a short table for the kids, and they even have drinks catered to the youngins (a kiduccino is steamed milk with honey)! Overall, such an adorable concept and very well executed; it matches well with the feel of rest of the neighborhood. 

Of course, the coffee here is amazing. My cappuccino was so smooth and creamy, and even the ceramics they serve in are so unique. Definitely a must-try if you're in the area!
author: Sabrina C.

description:
Another coffee place to love :)

Seating is kinda limited and this place is extremely charming and cute in Bernal Heights neighborhood but lots of natural sunlight comes in.

Standard $5 for a latte kind of coffee shop but it was delicious. Service was friendly too.
author: Mimi T.

description: Pinhole had great 3rd wave coffee and delicious fresh pastries. It had a fun, bright, and inviting atmosphere. I can't wait to return to this hit spot. It's great for a Sunday morning date with your partner or a kids morning out.
author: Lara I.

description:
A little quirky,
A lot more like an old school cafe.
Not so much hipster as just plain cool.
As in, the hipster characteristic that is there is complementary, rather than aggressive & overpowering.

Service is nice & attentive.   

The coffee is some of SF's best.  Blue Bottle, Verve, Linea.  

It's really very neighborhood.  Every time I've been in, the barista has known at least one of the patrons by name.

What's inside?  Building blocks.  Tree stump tables.  A Pinhole camera menagerie.  And even Pinhole onesies for the baby in your family.  

The pastry case features goodies from Marla Bakery & Pepples Donuts, among other local classics.  Gluten free, vegan, it's all here.

Pinhole has everything you could want, cafe wise.  Their shaken iced coffee is perfect on a warm day.

The new & best coffee spot in Bernal.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Best coffee shop in Bernal! Latte's are delicious, bring a book or a friend. Decor is fun and whismical. Staff are super nice and drinks are made consistently from my several times here. Take a stroll down main street after and enjoy the shops, or bring your cup to go!
author: Danielle H.

description:
My favorite cup of coffee on Cortland.  

You may order your coffee via quick drip or pour over.  The quick drip is usually from Linea Caffè and the pour over rotates about every 2 months.  My favorite so far was from a roaster in Michigan called Madcap.  You never know what will show up but it's bound to be amazing.  I usually get the pour over, but expect to for this to be prepared expertly.  I usually get to smell the grounds just after grinding. 

The espresso based drinks are usually made from Verve from Santa Cruz.  The espresso drinks are all on point and balanced.

Some items from local bakeries such as Piccino cookies, Midwife and the Baker scones, a and sometimes Black Jet Bakery pop tarts.

It's a great place to hang out and play with the magnetized board with letters.  Or your children ... or the adults.  Service is great.  Seating is a little limited with a few tables and a communal.  Parking is limited due to this being in a residential neighborhood.  Credit cards accepted.
author: Michael M.

description:
This place in Bernal is super cute.  I like the seats that are like tree trunk cut outs.  Staff is really nice.

They did a good matcha latte.  My other friends got espresso drinks and were all happy with them. They also had pretty good cookies at 3 for $5 (sea salt chocolate chip, double chocolate, and peanut butter).  We ended up getting a second round of cookies - they're soft and chewy in the center, nicely salted.

Note: no wifi.
author: Marilyn H.

description:
Latte: 5 stars
Ambience: 5 stars

Love this lively neighborhood coffee joint! Came here on an overcast Sunday, sat by the window to people-watch. We ordered almond lattes ($4) I'm not sure if it was real almond milk because it tasted so smooth and delicious.. We thought twice about asking the barista to confirm it's almond milk, but ended up sipping away happily instead. Before I knew it, the bottom of the mug was already visible :P They use Verve coffee and pulled very smooth espressos from it. 

The croissant we got to share ($3~) was extremely flaky, rich, fresh, all in a good way. Loved the plates and mugs they used as well. I'm excited to come back for a cappuccino and another enjoyable chat. :)
author: Maggie G.

description: This is, hands down, the best coffee shop in Bernal! The coffee is made to perfection. The owner and staff are outstandingly wonderful. They are truly neighbors in every sense of the word. My children love the baked goods. This is a must stop if you are in Bernal!
author: Julie D.

description:
So, you wake up on Memorial Day, turn on the computer, and observe how the rest of the United States is gearing up for the day: shorts, tank tops, barbecue grills, and ice cold beers.  You proceed to look outside your window to find only one thing: FOG. SO MUCH FOG. And so, rather than jumping out of bed to start marinating your ribs for the grill, you put on your North Face jacket, but not before putting on your sweats, socks, UGG boots, and sweater and head out in search for some warm coffee that'll comfort you for a few hours before going back to SF Summer Despondency.

This was my Memorial Day. And I celebrated with kicking things off at Pinhole Coffee in Bernal in search of trying the well-discussed Supersonic Coffee that's out of Berkeley. Pinhole is probably one of the most eccentric coffee shops I've been to.  Lots of building blocks and magnetic letters to play around with, but also a lot of whimsical art in and around the shop.  I enjoyed my hot brew, having a quick conversation with two very hipster but very nice baristas, and taking in the scenery of families, dogs, families + dogs, and individuals in search of some warm and comforting beverages.  I enjoyed the neighborhood feel to this place, and love that they have a variety of coffee options to offer!
author: Lisa I.

description:
If you run out of blocks on the table.
I saw some more over on the wall.
author: Dan B.

description: Discovered this place recently and now it's one of my favorite coffee spots in the city! And score on it being in Bernal Heights...my childhood neighborhood
author: Mia S.

description:
Beer is to coffee as a freehouse is to Pinhole: Most third wave coffee shops feature coffee from one roaster: Blue Bottle, Ritual, Verve, Four Barrel, Sightglass, etc., etc.  Pinhole has the best of the best; they deal with all (or most) of the above, and many more.  Not tied to any particular roaster, Pinhole will serve you on any given day the coffees that they deem to be best.

We came in and had a wonderful pourover made with beans from Chromatic Coffee and a world class cappuccino made with beans from ____ (whoops -- I forgot to ask!).  Customer service?  Top notch!  JoEllen D. is Bay Area coffee royalty and would rise to the crema in any group of baristas.  Also, she loves her customers and her customers love her.

Pinhole is maybe the best coffee shop on the planet.  Surely it's the best on the block (and there's no lack of competition).  Try it?  You'll love it!  I sure did.
author: Kenneth R.

description: I enjoyed sipping on a mocha and munching on a strawberry poptart while reading my book at the window counter seat on a recent trip up to SF. Small little shop with about 2-3 tables and some window counter seats. Very chill hipster vibe and simple menu. Cute little typewriter decor by the window, including one that holds treats for your four-legged companion.
author: Kathy L.

description:
IN LOVE.

I was searching for a coffee joint that serves Verve coffee and happened to stumble upon Pinhole Coffee. I'm sure everyone has already said it all in previous reviews so I hope my pictures can do justice.

The interior, wow. They definitely incorporated their brand with a young, organic vibe. The custom wood benches along the walls and custom stumps and stools bring warmth into the room. The colorful tiled wall and the printed wall (behind) incorporates a playfulness to this modern look. I literally have work soon and I am tempted to call in sick so I can go home and grab a book (shh don't tell my boss)

It was rather foggy and cold this morning so I had the almond latte ($4) today. The latte art was pretty and the milk came out light and frothy. I feel like that's usually hard to create with non-dairy milk, but this cup of deliciousness was made to perfection. 

This has made my day!
author: Linda K.

description: Great service and comfortable setting here at this local coffee shop. The atmosphere was inviting and my mocha was beautiful and tasty. Also, you should try the salted chocolate chip cookies :P
author: Daniel B.

description: One of the cutest coffee shops I have been to. Not going to lie, the main reason why I came here is because I saw pictures of this place on IG and it all looked so cool. This place didn't disappoint. Their lattes are pretty good and their pastries are too. I just wish this place had a few more tables/seats for one to actually stay and enjoy the coffee & art
author: Stephanie C.

description: Very friendly neighborhood coffee shop that was recommended by our Airbnb host -- he was spot on. Baristas have great interaction and banter with guests. Love the interior design and vibe of the place. And the coffee is REALLY good. They rotate some coffees to keep their regulars exploring new roasters, and have even featured my local fav Mad Cap from Grand Rapids, MI. And the pastries are great too--chocolate croissant, Danish, scones (buckwheat raspberry and matcha).
author: Susan B.

description:
Came to Pinhole Coffee for about 2 hours on an early Friday afternoon.  I found this place through Instagram; I saw the colorful tiles and knew that I had to come here!

Just like the photos I saw on Instagram, Pinhole has a really nice interior design scheme, a lot of wood/industrial furniture with splashes of color on the pillows and (of course) the wall.  The entire left wall is full of long, colorful rectangular tiles.  It's very "San Francisco".  For a Friday afternoon, it was really empty and quiet-which makes it a really nice place for productivity working. The staff here is also really friendly, which is a huge plus.

In terms of coffee beans, I believe they use 3 different coffee beans-Verve, Linea, and AKA.

The only downside was that when I went, the Wi-Fi wasn't working (or maybe they don't even have Wi-Fi). Someone has an XFINITY Wi-Fi router nearby, so you could potentially use that for an hour (free) or indefinitely (if you're an XFINITY customer). 

Overall, it's great! I would definitely come back.
author: David W.

description:
Saturday, 4:45 PM.
Note: no wi-fi.

Quickie:
+ Drink quality
+ Service
* Hygiene
+ Atmosphere
+ Turnaround
+ Menu variety
+ Layout

And then...?
Pinhole Coffee is like the 'Cheers' of this area. The friendly staff knew most of the patrons. They've created a great ambience for visitors.

**********
Stuffed my face in:
1. Latte
     + Rich roast
2. Chocolate Chip Cookies
     + Baked in-house: chewy and full of chips

Constructive comment:
*Expand food menu
author: Chuck N.

description:
Pinhole Coffee is great place to take a break while hanging out in Bernal Heights. 

From the quirky decor to the good coffee, it's a nice place to have a seat and pause. It wasn't super crowded when I stopped by and I felt like I was able to linger over my cappucino. While the cappuccino was not in my top 5 (I prefer a smoother cappuccino a la Blue Bottle), the space and location would definitely bring me back. There are a lot of great plants, individually unique coffee cups, and other interesting things to draw your eye, you can tell that a lot of thought went into the design of their space. And, I liked their stuff so much that I bought a coffee thermos. :)

Staff was nice and the space was clean!
author: Cindy L.

description:
The vibrant setting, friendly staff, wonderful service and the delicious mocha are probably some of the several reason to return to this newly found coffee shop. I was walking along Cortland Avenue to look for a local coffee shop in the neighborhood of Bernal Heights. Luckily, I saw Pinhole. The colorful interiors are fascinating. I think it is generally designed for everyone, including children and pets. It is dog friendly and child friendly. 

I will definitely visit this coffee shop sometime again.
author: Dan Mark D.

description: Good coffee and friendly staff. Lots of regulars coming thru. I tried the latte and americano, I'd buy both again. The chocolate croissant was a good way to start the day as well.
author: David S.

description: So many wonderful things to say about Pinhole. The aesthetics, friendly staff, gluten-free treats, and the music. It's really all perfect.
author: Bree G.

description:
We have discovered we are full blown coffee snobs with Pinhole two blocks away.  Best comment I've heard

"You can tell bad coffee when you need a lot of sugar, you can tell good coffee when you need none"

Delicious brew, awesome staff, worth every cup
author: Chuck D.

description: If you are looking for the best coffee shop in San Francisco, this is it.  Amazing coffee, cool setting, and truly wonderful and welcoming people.
author: Christopher M.

description:
OHHHHH!!

Love this spot. The seating area is super unique, the vibe is calm, drinks are delicious, and the service is friendly.

I almost always order a cappuccino, especially when checking out a new spot. I've been here a few times, and the coffee is amazing. Last time, I picked up a cookie as well, whhhhaaat? Good stuff.
author: Amy O.

description:
I'll be quick with this. Pinhole is an awesome unique SF cafe serving some of the region's best (Verve, Blue Bottle)

What: SF coffee shop with special character found no where else. Hipster mixed in with a cool childhood colorful feel!

Where: Bernal Heights Area, close to some parks if you're willing to walk. Parking is a hit or miss, but worth the time invested once you step inside.

When: Came on a chill Saturday afternoon. Couple bloggers and people reading books. Not the best for studying since outlets are almost non-existent

This cafe is super cool for it's unique interior design. Baristas and the owner are very kind as well. They also got a bathroom which is a nice when nature calls. They got cool tree stumps as seats, but its not the most comfortable. 

First timers try the shaken ice coffee or vanilla latte! They might have free wifi? I was connected to xfinity but my friend wasn't able to connect.
author: Brian L.

description: Excellent coffee, friendly staff, cool atmosphere, but no WiFi. I was shocked that a coffee shop in San Francisco wouldn't have wifi. Otherwise it would have been 5 stars.
author: C V.

description:
Pinhole Coffee is quirky, quaint, and beautiful. The barista is super friendly (shoutout to Maxine!), and it was really comfortable chatting here for a couple of hours with my boyfriend and friend.

My cappuccino was great, and they carry really great cookies! If you're not feeling caffeine, go for the kiduccino (steamed milk, honey, and cinnamon).
author: Karen L.

description:
Cute cafe with good cappuccino. 
Parking wasn't hard to find on a weekday.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Go here for the awesome coffee. While you're there enjoy the mural of Bernal Hill. 

Seriously Pinhole has been a great addition to the many great local merchant along Cortland Ave. 

The SF nostalgic part of me loves seeing the old Muni Tokens in the penny tiles.
author: Kelly S.

description: My neighborhood gem - Joellen has created a spot - sanctuary, even - that mirrors our incredibly special community in NW Bernal. So much love for Pinhole (also - the coffee - well, you just need to experience for yourself)
author: O B.

description:
So good.
I got four different drinks and loved them all.
The staff is just this side of Fred Rogers when it comes to being warm and polite.
The owner of this establishment is just a total peach!
You would be lucky to live in this neighborhood.
author: James P.

description:
My review: 
Meh, I won't be back. This is my second time here -  That last time, it cost me about 15.00 for two kids hot chocolates, and one item from the bakery case. Despite the crazy prices, I decided to try it again, but the rude attitude will keep me from trying it again. It's too bad:  they carry lots of fancy expensive coffee. The decor is nice, if not a little repetitive in that sort of Flora Grubb-modern-succulent-repurposed-wood-Mission newcomer kind of way. It feels like a Sunset magazine review come to life. That is not a compliment, by the way. I don't want to live in Sunset Magazine. 

Some tips for Pinhole:  there is a right way and a wrong way to handle the situation when someone comes in (not knowing you don't have WIFI) just, and only just, to do work on her computer. 

1. Be apologetic if she has already paid for her drink when you explain that you don't have WIFI. Don't be smug. A tiny bit of kindness goes a long way. Don't sneer and say "all the coffee shops I go to don't have WIFI anymore".  Assistant manager: don't tell your customer that your business is about making money not about people. It might be true, but it sounds awful when you say it right out loud like that. 

2. Be kind when you say you can't give a refund when your customer asks for money back on the completely untouched cup of tea, when she explains she now has to go to another spot that has WIFI.  I get it if you didn't want to refund my money.  Fair enough. It's more about how you treated me. You could have had a customer for life for 2.50 instead of someone who will tell anyone who will listen to avoid this place. Which I will. Think about this. You got to keep your 2.50 but you are losing way more money than that. 

BTW: I actually am glad some coffee shops are taking out WIFI.  I like the idea of having a place where not every person is on a screen. However, my issue is with the snobby way I was treated.
author: Carla G.

description:
The decor is colorful and fun to look at. The latte is rich smooth and flavorful. Just the perfect amount of foam ratio. I did not need to add anything to it. The customer service here is great. This was my first time here and they made me feel welcome. We were offered a punch card and a freebie extra punch since we were new. About 10min later we were offered sparkling water. Most baristas ignore your existence once you order. Also it was nice to see a bin of doggie treats. :)

Food/beverage 5 stars
Customer service 5 stars
Decor 5 stars
author: elle f.

description:
Oh so good!
JoEllen is super nice and I love that she sells local bakery items. Especially the pop tarts from Little Bee Baking up the hill. Great coffee, wonderful ambiance and a welcome addition to our little corner of the city.
Bravo!
author: Katie S.

description: It's unbelievable how much community JoEllen has created around her lovely little café. The coffee is some of the best in the city, sure, but on top of that the space is beautiful and welcoming and queer- and family-friendly, and always full of art from local artists, and it seems like every weekend JoEllen is donating all her revenue to a progressive cause. It feels like our Bernal clubhouse.
author: Rachel C.

description: Flat white was slightly too hot but ratio of milk and espresso was on point. They have stuff like piccolo which you don't really see in other places. It's a nice cozy place conducive for hanging out or working since it doesn't get too noisy. It's not a very big area but decor is welcoming and very bright, giving a cozy feel. Seats cater to solo caffeine addicts to mid-size groups.
author: Erica Y.

description: Great coffee, peaceful shop, fast service. Like to grab an iced coffee and walk up to Holy Park to enjoy the sun.
author: Elisa T.

description:
Owner JoEllen is the sweetest person ever. A long-time Blue Bottle manager, this is her new shop. Wonderful coffee from BB, Verve and Linea, as well as local pastries and other small bites. 

The shop has a beautiful design and is a very welcoming space. A great addition to Bernal.
author: Chris M.

description: No good coffee places in Excelsior yet so this is the closest gourmet coffee place. Child friendly. Children's books. Magnetic alphabet. You can tie your dog in the front and have a seat on the bench on a warm day. Everyone here generally seems in a good mood which makes for great atmosphere.
author: Rob L.

description: Crazy good coffee. Small but excellent selection of pastries. Great ambience. Extremely friendly "coffee geek" employees. A neighborhood gem.
author: Damon M.

description: Cute but grossly overpriced. For price level they should at least serve organic milk and organic half an half and gold plated teas. Then it would feel worth it for the value. Leaves you with a bad feeling when price is so high, but ambiance is very nice. Good hangout for people who don't have to live on a budget.
author: Mary M.

description:
I love their interior but not as much as I love their coffee! Their lattes are made to perfection and their pour over is amazing. They have different coffees from Verve, Blue Bottle, Andytown Coffee Roasters. Joellen really knows her coffee and can tell you the difference between the beans, how they make their coffee (Chemex, pourover, drip, etc). 

Pro:
+ very friendly people
+ nice sitting area, interior decor is on point
+ amazing coffee
+ i enjoy their ceramic cups

Con
- I came here two days in a row and still didnt get offered a stamp card :(
- no wifi, but hey, sometimes its nice to not have to be on your laptop or computer
author: Carmen C.

description: This is a little up and coming coffee shop on a quiet street in Bernal Heights. Coffee was good, 4/5 stars. Lacked in pastries. I sat inside and had my drink. This place is pretty quiet and not a ton of foot traffic, but it's probably because there's no wifi, which is very bizarre for a coffee shop. Kind of nice actually, if you want to skip the hustle and bustle of starbucks.
author: Tanya Y.

description: Pin hole cameras, tree log tables and seats theme. It's cozzy, warm and fresh.
author: Wayne Z.

description:
This place is incredible. The coffee, decor, and pastries are all on point. It's a perfect fit for Bernal. The staff is super knowledgeable but completely unpretentious. They cycle through beans from local roasters to keep things interesting, which is a great way to sample what's out there or enjoy favorites.

If Blue Bottle's New Orleans Iced is normally your thing, go for the shaken when you come here
author: Matt S.

description: Friendly baristas, cute 'hood, soft cookies, warm& sunny. What more do you need from a coffee shop?
author: Megan B.

description:
I decided to pay a visit to Pinhole Coffee after hearing so much positive praise about this specific shop. It has such a great environment and the owner, JoEllen, is an amazing and charismatic individual as well.

Unlike most other coffee shops, she's devoted a lot of her time getting to know her customers and developing a relationship with them, making it easy to become a regular here.

This spot has been open for about several months now and I'm sure it's going to continue thriving. JoEllen, congratulations again on your success and thanks for being a source of light to those in the neighborhood. Looking forward to my next visit here.
author: Armando A.

description: Great coffee, homey and warm atmosphere, good pastries. I like the homemade poptarts.  There are a lot of little artistic and design details fun to look at: wall of different colored pieces of wood, complicated mural of guy with a camera with Bernal Hill in the background, beach glass mobile, little epiphyte plants and so on! Always something new. Popular with locals.
author: Liz H.

description: Espresso was on the level of best spots in the city. Stylish interior and friendly service.
author: Leon G.

description:
This place hits all the high points of everything that is nice about a cafe, plus more:

--Excellent coffee and espresso (local/artisan roasters on rotation), for pour-over, drip, and espresso-based fancy drinks

--Friendly and competent service

--Serves neighborhood need--perfect Cortland/Bernal location on the western end of Cortland

--Excellent decor. It's artistic, beautiful, and loudly colored fun mixed in with reclaimed wood.

More:

--VERY green, yay! There are no wooden stir sticks or plastic straws. There are no individual sugar packets. It's really amazing how much coffee shop waste this place cuts down it, and more cafes should follow their lead. It keeps the doctoring station cleaner too.
author: Stephanie P.

description: Great pour over, ample seating, but apparently a hot spot for the parade and local bazaar. Not an ideal place to work or study. But if you like catching up with old friends by way casual shouting, finally, this place brings the SF bar scene decibel level to you at 11am on a weekday.
author: Amanda A.

description: I really like this place. It is a bit pricier than other places but they have the best lattes in the neighborhood in my opinion! The owner is very professional and is pretty nice. I haven't always had the best experience service-wise but it seems to be getting better since they opened and hopefully it will last! I also really like the look of the cafe and the art they have.
author: Aya I.

description: Expensive and not that delicious. Small serving sizes. Spent 4.5 on a 12 ounce chai that tasted like warm milk, but my Nutella pop tart was yummy and fresh. I will not be coming here again. The atmosphere is nice and the decor is stylish, but I was disappointed with my drink . Next time I want a morning beverage I will go to Martha Bros or Progressive Grounds down the street.
author: Molly D.

description: If you are walking through Bernal Heights on a cool afternoon make sure to Stop by Pinhole for delicious hot cholocate. The place is really kid friendly! They even have a 2$ kiduccino!
author: Victoria L.

description: Great coffee. Very focused on bean quality, preparation, and atmosphere. Great decor and very kid friendly. Found it to be a bit pricey. Limited food options (no hot food) but very delicious savory and sweet scones.
author: Stephen Y.

description: These guys ROCK. JoeEllen the owner has done a great job of creating an inviting space at the West end of Courtland. My Americano was perfect. Better yet, the team behind the counter were nice and engaging. Pinhole is my new go-to for fabulous coffee in Bernal.
author: Gary C.

description: Super cute atmosphere for a quick cup of joe, or to people-watch, to sit & enjoy the art, or grab coffee with a friend. Whatever tickles your pickle, this coffee shop is definitely a gem in the heart of Bernal Heights, with an aura that fits perfectly with the neighborhood's community (: thank you, JoEllen for making all your customers feel welcomed. Will definitely be back to share it this hot spot with others.
author: Alyssaaa S.

description:
Smiling barista and beautiful space!  Colors, mural, wood furniture, and all the details are amazing here!!

I have tried Cappuccino and Piccolo so far. Both were beautifully made, and were perfect!!! And I really liked Biscotti.

Dog friendly (free dog treats) 
Kids friendly (kid's menu)

I wish I live close enough to visit regularly.
author: Micky T.

description:
I didn't like the coffee at all 
It was way too strong and bitter for my preferences 
On the plus side the Batista can do coffee art 
She made a leaf with a heart at the top!
I got a non fat decaf latte i ended up adding a bunch of sugar and milk but then it was too sweet
I got a gluten free mini bundut cake blueberry flavor 
That was really yummy
When i went in there it was around lunch time and there were two customer's in there sitting down on their technology devices
The barista and a man she was giving coffee to
It is very. Modern 
It reminds me of being in the middle of a forest and a kitchen at the same time with all the tree rings and refrigerator letters
My total was seven dollars.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
WONDERFUL WONDERFUL WONDERFUL

We feel like at home every time we step foot in this shop. One of the most legit, honest, and humble businesses in SF. Owner Jo-Ellen is amazing, she is hospitable and does so with a smile!
Jo-Ellen, David, Rylee, Ben, and on occasion Cat you guys make our mornings so much brighter. Thank you thank you!
author: Mario M.

description: Super smooth espresso. Friendly and charming workers. Really great ingredients. Plenty of seating. What more can one ask for?
author: mariel v.

description: We love this place! It's a great neighborhood spot and they are super baby-friendly without being obnoxious about it. The baristas will mention how adorable your child is, and there are kids books, but no one lets their kids run wild or take over. Jo Ellen, the owner, is a really sweet and fun woman with a passion for coffee. The baristas are friendly and fast, and the seating is great for conversation. Sometimes we wish they had wifi so you could work there, but I have a feeling that's the point--they probably don't want you camping out for hours. It's definitely more of a meet-up-with-friends, hang out place than somewhere to work.
author: Lauren C.

description: Vibrant spot with beautiful wood furniture, delicious coffee and chill music - grear add to bernal!
author: Elana R.

description: This is a very charming little coffeehouse.  I wish they were here when I was hanging around Bernal more often!  The decor is thoughtful with interesting art and other things to look at while talking or taking a break from my book.  I like that they don't have wi-fi.  This non laptop farm feeling contributed to the chill vibe.  The woman working behind the counter was extremely friendly and made us feel very welcome.  Last but not least the coffees were fantastic.  Living in the Bay Area I am spoiled and Pinhole definitely didn't disappoint.
author: Jessica L.

description: Damn good iced coffee drinks. I am crazy picky and really only appreciate a handful of cafes in the city, this is now one of them. It is very cute inside, and the baristas were friendly and quick. This place is such a great addition to Cortland:)
author: Shana A.

description: Stopped by this absolutely amazing cafe in Bernal Heights, and was greeted by quite possibly the friendliest barista I've ever encountered! There are lots of interesting little bits and bobs tucked in every corner, and the colourful wall across from the brewing area will definitely catch your eye. The space itself was fairly large, and has a cool homey vibe to it. I got a latte ($4 something) and was definitely pleased by the quality and coffee art. They also have a variety of cookies and treats to go with your coffee, and also make piccolo's, which is pretty uncommon in most the cafes I've been to. It was pretty empty for an early afternoon, and I'm glad to see that Pinhole is more of a place to hang out than a workspace filled with hipster laptop users! It's pretty likely that I'll be coming back next time I'm in the area :)
author: Cindy N.

description: Best coffee on Cortland and a welcome addition to the neighborhood. Love this place and the best ever almond milk froth I have experienced.
author: Christina G.

description:
Cute little coffee shop.  Staff is super friendly.  I first stopped in to check it out but was already caffeinated.  I probably looked sweaty from hiking around the hill, so the barista offered me a glass of water.  I thought that was very nice.

I'll be back soon to try the coffee - happy to see some a coffee specialist on cortlandSan.
author: Josh F.

description:
So  I've been stalking this place for months, waiting like an impatient scorned lover for them to open up their warm, caffeinated arms and embrace me. Finally! They are open and it was worth the wait. The  decor is  sleek yet stimulating with a cool local geography mural in coffee colors and a lovely accent wall that makes everything in front of it look artsy.  The coffee is excellent, high quality, and artistically made. I usually use sugar, but they make it so rich and sweet there is no need. The staff is super nice and they all have nice smiles that they use frequently. 

Welcome Pinhole Coffee! Will you be my new BFF?
author: Heather R.

description: Vibrant spot with beautiful wood furniture, delicious coffee and chill music - grear add to bernal!
author: Elana R.

description: Been coming here for months and felt it was time to give it 5 stars. I come here almost every morning for a shaken iced coffee and piccolo. Great coffee, very friendly baristas, friendly customers, great pastries, and oftentimes you'll see dogs waiting outside. You'll never find another coffee shop that celebrates the neighborhood as much as this one. The owner is always switching things up (interior decor) so it's always fun to notice the little differences every time.
author: Rosa T.

description: Love it here, I stop often.  Great atmosphere, delicious coffee, interesting music and friendly staff.  You can choose different coffee roasters to try.  Often have Verve, Linea and Chromatic.
author: Amy D.

description: I refuse to sit on a tree stub as a "chair" and the spendy iced coffee drink that they sold me on, with the condensed milk was disappointing, and served in a little paper cup full of ice...otherwise, I like the idea of the place, and enjoy their coffee.
author: Jay T.

description: Always enjoy Pinhole -- such great coffee, but feel that yesterday's experience requires a positive review. While waiting in line, I asked Corey at the register if they took Apple Pay, since I didn't have my wallet but did have my phone. She said yep, so I waited, but when it came time to pay, the Apple Pay part of the machine was broken. I was ready to head home without my cappuccino, but she was having none of that. She served up my two cappuccinos for free. I promised to come back to pay, but she wasn't worried. (I did come back later to pay.)  I just thought that her customer-first approach was great!
author: Robert F.

description: Couldn't wait for this coffee shop to open... I was SO disappointed. My wife & I walked in... Not a comfortable chair/seat in the place... $5. Coffee & very limited eats... Folks on computers... Valencia Street has come to bernal. So sad.
author: Chris Ellen M.

description:
There's coffee, and then there's Pinhole.
Well, we have a perfectly capable espresso machine at our home in Bernal Heights. It feels a bit neglected since Pinhole opened.
It's just such a treat to stroll down the street and get a masterly built coffee from JoEllen and her wonderful crew. I trust her choice of beans. 
Most of the time, we run into friends and neighbors. With the cool artwork and all the whimsical touches, we treat Pinhole as our extended living room.
author: Laurno T.

description: Meh. Overpriced. Reeks of twee: only beverage lightener offered is half-n-half. If you're vegan or avoiding saturated fat for health reasons, fuggedaboutit. Good luck with that. Very limited snacks, like 10 things in the tiny pastry case - not 10 *kinds* of things - literally, 10 items. Attitudinal service (hipster guy, I'm talking to you). One star for quality beans. One star for bowl of free dog treats. Zero stars for crazy prices based on beverage size. Zero stars for employee dickishness.
author: Emily D.

description: Yay! love this place so far!  Coffee is delicious and today i tried their "shaken" iced latte.  It may be my new go to drink.  Another HUGE plus is that they offer baked goods from local bakeries.  Today they had cookies from Marlas Bakery and of course I couldn't resist considering the trek I'd have to make to get there.  Maybe they'll offer donuts some time? :) Another huge plus: decor is super cute.  love the happy colorful painted wall.  I hope I don't get addicted to their coffees as I live right down the street but I'm craving one already!  I'm so happy they opened on Cortland.
author: Sue L.

description: Such an adorable place! The coffee was really yummy and the staff was nice and patient with all my annoying questions about their unique coffee. I really loved their mugs too lol the barista told me they're all individually crafted by a friend of theirs which I thought was cool!
author: Page F.

description: Pinhole coffee is awesome. Gorgeous inside, run by lovely people, great coffee, great pastries. The cheese scone is to die for. The chocolate milk is fantastic.
author: Fred A.

description:
Finally, great coffee without the attitude!  A barista who smiles!  I don't remember the last time I felt this welcome in a coffee shop in SF.  The owner was so happy to meet the neighbors, asking peoples' names.  This is how all businesses should be.

Perfect coffee, delicious goodies, welcoming environment, good music (perfect volume), treats for my doggie tied up outside.  Just wish I didn't have to trek over the hill to get there, but it's worth it.  Welcome!
author: Opk H.

description: This place is an amazing addition to Cortland.  The drip coffee is top notch, service is excellent, and the decor is incredibly cozy.
author: Lindsay L.

description: Great coffee with a very interesting, artistic space.  They use Verve Coffee Roasters on espresso, Blue Bottle Coffee on quick brew and Linea on pour-over.
author: Ron E.

description: This wonderful coffee shop embodies the relaxed and cozy feel of Bernal Heights. A latte is $4 and they also offer a nice selection of small pastries and cookies. There is no wifi so expect to bring a friend or a book.
author: K J.

description: JoEllen is great. The staff is excellent.  Most of them are current or former Blue Bottle. Finally a high quality coffee in Bernal.  Excellent addition the hood.
author: Christian M.

description: I'm going to go ahead and say that this is a great coffee shop for people who don't really love coffee, but definitely love the idea of coffee. Great space, nice staff, solid location, but the beans themselves aren't all that great.  Good, but not great. And for me, not worth the price tag. But if you prefer darker roasts, this could be your perfect neighborhood coffee spot.
author: Karla R.

description: It took years to get amazing coffee in Bernal Heights but it has arrived with this new little shop on the slopes of Cortland, pride of ownership is felt as soon as you walk in the door and like me, you will come back for more!
author: Jeffrey W.

description: When I frequented Blue Bottle, Joellen was a barista there, and recently had given me a card for her new business, Pinhole Coffee. I finally got a chance to try it, and it was great!  The space is beautiful, Joellen herself is so nice and friendly, and my fiancé's shaken ice coffee was soooo yummy! I will definitely return any time I'm in Bernal.
author: Diana R.

description: We went to Pinhole the Friday after Thanksgiving, our first time. The space is so wonderful, the baristas SO GREAT. One of them noticed that I did not finish my latte and when I went to the counter about an hour later (we hung out there a LONG time!) the guy who made it asked me if something was wrong with it (he noticed) and offered that it might be the roasting with that batch and said, "Your chai is on us." Totally kind and charming. He took great care to make my husband's cappuccino exactly as requested, super dry, and it was excellent. The croissants were extremely fresh. We'll be back!
author: Beth W.

description: Pinhole is a perfect neighborhood coffee shop! Fantastic coffee; welcoming ambience for kids, dogs and adult coffee seekers alike; tasty baked treats from Piccino and Little Bee Bakery; and friendly staff.
author: Tim D.

description:
This place is super cute! OK, maybe just a teeeensy bit over the top on the twee scale, but they get away with it by serving excellent coffee with a friendly vibe. 

I'm holding out hope for a larger selection of bakery items in the future but I may be unusually partial to the mid-afternoon coffee/chocolate combination.
author: K S.

description: wow i can't believe people are giving a low rating on this coffee shop that has the best cup of coffee ever. hello its a coffee shop it has great coffee, what more would you like?!
author: Isabella T.

description: Great coffee! The Latte's are really good. Fantastic, delicious pastries! Clean, cute inside, great vibe.  Highly recommend you stop by it.
author: Alex M.

description: Pinhole is the coffee shop I've been looking for! They cycle through different coffees like Verve, blue bottle, and tandem to name a few. I always get the shaken iced coffee because its like magic in a cup. I've been told that the other drinks are pretty amazing too but I just can't stray from the frothy sweet goodness. There's always some tasty treat from local bakers of Bernal Heights like fig pop tarts too. JoEllen, the owner is a friendly as it gets and she has equal minded employees manning the bar.  There's a bowl of dog treats on the counter too. A real neighborhood gem!
author: Danielle P.

description: Great, great addition to the neighborhood. Perfect coffee (Blue Bottle, Verve, Linnea), delicious pastries, beautiful, inviting space, friendly staff. The only things less than perfect are lack of Wifi (I think they're working on that) and limited seating.
author: Caroline P.

description: I REALLY want to like this place - especially because I waited so long for it to open. But I just gave it a 3rd shot and it's just too pricy for a too small, very meh cup of coffee.
author: Sue D.

description: I popped in for an iced coffee over the weekend (during one of our rare San Francisco heat waves).  The staff was very friendly but I was a bit disappointed in the pricing   (prices which may be in line with competitors). I'm probably out of step with current coffee pricing since I make my own coffee every morn and carry on to MUNI, sipping as we roll over the hill.  I probably won't be spending too much time in this cafe - but the coffee was delicious, even if I grumbled about the small cup costing me $4.
author: Joe B.

description: Awesome management, classy setup, delicious coffee, and the highest quality bottled water around.
author: Laini H.
